metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: So that's to say you'd like to pry a little? You do seem like the type, I must say.
4.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers if SH approves of the player for less than 10NodeContext: Playing mind games - goading the player in order to avoid actually answering their questions.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: It was just a thought. No need to take offence.
51.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent, and a bit of an amateur psychiatrist.

264.speaker: Shadowheart
264.text: Just an observation, no offence taken. See? We're learning something about each other already.
264.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent, and a bit of an amateur psychiatrist.

225.speaker: Shadowheart
225.text: For instance, you're a quick-to-anger type, aren't you? Even less self-control than brains.
225.context: NodeContext: A deliberate provocation, spoken with a smile. All to distract from actually giving a straightforward answer.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: In every moment of silence, I find my thoughts drift to blood.

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: Perhaps I should hire a bard to follow you around and make a constant racket then. Just to be safe.

235.speaker: Shadowheart
235.text: I jest. And hopefully you do as well. Shall we?

6.speaker: Player
6.text: That's out of line. You don't know me.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: Heh, there it is! Oh don't pout, you walked right into that. And there's no harm in a little hot-bloodedness.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: No harm at all, in fact...

278.speaker: Player
278.text: If you want to throw caution to the wind, so be it...

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.text: Don't get too ahead of yourself. I'm just having a little fun.

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: Nor are you mine, as it stands.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: But who's to say? I might need a distraction some evening. These campsites do get cold...

159.speaker: Player
159.text: If you get cold, throw another log on the campfire.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Hrmph. I suppose. I also suppose I'll have to rely on myself to stave off boredom.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: On reflection, I might not be the warmest body in the camp.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: There's more than one way to keep me warm. We'll see. Maybe.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: You're deflecting. I want to know about you.

290.speaker: Shadowheart
290.text: And I've revealed all I'm willing to - at least for now.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: Now I suggest you let matters rest, or else we'd better part ways.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: You insinuate much. If your carnal needs are so great, we can retire to a copse immediately.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: Perhaps... not right now. As tempting as you make it sound.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Heh. You're like an eager, pale puppy. Let's not take things too fast...

258.speaker: Player
258.text: You expressed disdain for my kind before - why do you now signal lust?

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Firstly, you may need to soften that githyanki way with words a little.

347.speaker: Shadowheart
347.text: And secondly, no harm in trying something at least once. Even if you don't ultimately like it.

168.speaker: Shadowheart
168.text: After all, it can get awfully cold at night out here in this wilderness...

195.speaker: Player
195.text: You're just trying to goad me to avoid talking honestly - what're you hiding?

311.speaker: Player
311.text: The type? What do you mean?
311.context: NodeContext: Amateur psychiatrist; looking to get a rise out of the player and avoid answering their questions.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: Inquisitive. Looking for connection... it's every man for himself and you're looking to make friends.
120.context: NodeContext: Amateur psychiatrist; looking to get a rise out of the player and avoid answering their questions.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: Admirable, I suppose. Or desperate. I'm not quite sure.
25.context: NodeContext: Thrown out casually, but in fact intended to provoke.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You're not the judge of character you suppose to be.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Oh, I think you'll find that I am. Knowing what makes people tick is... a skill of mine.

303.speaker: Shadowheart
303.text: If you want something from a person, you need to know when and where to squeeze.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Nod along, thinking of squeezing a neck - pushing out every drop of blood.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: Heh. You seem a little lost in your thoughts. I can leave you to them, unless there's something else?

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Mock all you like - it's clearly just a front.

302.speaker: Shadowheart
302.text: That's all you're entitled to, for now. Our parasite problem doesn't make you my confidante.

350.speaker: Player
350.text: You're not entirely wrong. This is all a little... new.

64.speaker: Shadowheart
64.text: Hmm. A refreshing dose of honesty. Careful people don't take advantage of that.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: Unless you want to be taken advantage of, that is...

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Yes, I'm the type to pry. Are you the type to answer?
219.context: NodeContext: Teasing. Her efforts to distract you from your personal question aren't working, but she's not through yet.

257.speaker: Shadowheart
257.text: My, look at you: straight as an arrow, right to the point every time...
257.context: NodeContext: Teasing. Her efforts to distract you from your personal question aren't working, but she's not through yet.

249.speaker: Shadowheart
249.text: ...this isn't the tadpole I'm speaking to, is it? The personality seems a little lacking...
249.context: NodeContext: Deliberate provocation, spoken with a smile. A distraction technique from actually answering a personal question.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: You've got me. I am the mighty tadpole. This body is my vessel.

331.speaker: Shadowheart
331.text: And that's the vessel you chose?

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: I jest. It's good to know you're not entirely without a sense of humour. Shall we?

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: You're as discreet as you are pale. Admirable.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You're deflecting. Got something to hide?

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: Me? I'm not hiding anything. I'm merely sharing as much as you deserve to know.

251.speaker: Shadowheart
251.text: And right now, you've reached your limit. Let's talk about something else.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I've changed my mind. We can get to know each other another time.

272.speaker: Shadowheart
272.text: Oh don't worry. I'm learning about you with each passing moment.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: I haven't even dared to use the more benign forms of illithid powers - do you really think I'm eager to jump to the next step?
16.context: NodeContext: Playful/romantic. Partner asked for a kiss.

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.context: NodeContext: Playful/romantic. Partner asked for a kiss.

128.speaker: Player
128.context: NodeContext: Playful/romantic. Partner asked for a kiss.

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: Playful/romantic. Partner asked for a kiss.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: Well don't stand on ceremony - come here.
136.context: NodeContext: Playful/romantic. Partner asked for a kiss.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: I wish I could kiss you.
156.context: NodeContext: Longing (Karlach, her love interest, can't physically touch anyone at present without burning up)

172.speaker: Shadowheart
172.text: I know. And the feeling's mutual. I'll settle for gazing into those eyes for now.
172.context: NodeContext: Longing (Karlach, her love interest, can't physically touch anyone at present without burning up)

300.speaker: Player
300.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

327.speaker: Shadowheart
327.text: Whole - at last. Thank you, for being by my side through all of this. I never realised I could have a true family - or a true love.

282.speaker: Shadowheart
282.text: At peace, I think. I couldn't have imagined how things were going to play out - what I'd gain, who I'd lose... but at least I have your support.

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: What can I say? I've fulfilled my destiny, become everything Lady Shar wished of me. And in no small part thanks to you.

197.speaker: Shadowheart
197.text: Better, now, I think. Now that I know the truth. Now that I have my family - and you.

206.speaker: Shadowheart
206.text: Honestly? My heart's racing. The end's close - my parents are close. I just know it. Thank you - I'm not sure I would have ever made it this far without you.

312.speaker: Shadowheart
312.text: Honestly? My nerves are aflame - I'm almost home, and Lady Shar's final test awaits. Thank you - I'm not sure I would have ever made it this far without you.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Nervous, perhaps. When we entered Wyrm's Crossing, it felt like it might be the beginning of the end. Whatever happens, I'm glad it's with you next to me.

285.speaker: Shadowheart
285.text: I'm not sure what to feel... my parents are alive? And I need to save them? I'm lucky to have you by my side - I don't think I could face what's to come, otherwise.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: Thriving. Lady Shar's foes continue to fall, and she continues to honour me... but she wants me all to herself. What we share... may be difficult to maintain.

330.speaker: Shadowheart
330.text: Better than I thought possible. I have done as Lady Shar wished, and she had rewarded me in turn. All is well... or almost. The Nightsinger wants my heart - all of it.

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: Relieved? Terrified? Sick to my stomach? I can't keep my feelings straight, ever since I spared Nightsong, defied Shar. I don't know what comes next, but at least I have you by my side.

246.speaker: Shadowheart
246.text: Well... I'd be lying if I said I hadn't been dwelling on becoming a Dark Justiciar. Perhaps seeing the power of Shar unleashed on that land is keeping the thought in my mind...

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: But don't worry - I still have plenty of room for you in both mind and heart.

221.speaker: Shadowheart
221.text: Always good, when I'm with you - even in perilous lands such as these.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: It's strange... I've been dwelling on what I told you before - about wanting to become a Dark Justiciar. But perhaps I should be content with my lot - I'm already blessed to have you at my side, after all.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Always good, when I'm with you.

15.speaker: Player
15.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I feel like you've been distracted of late. I don't want us to drift apart.
153.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

351.speaker: Shadowheart
351.text: I... I won't pretend that I don't know what you mean. Ever since we entered the Shadow Curse, I've felt like something's calling to me. Some purpose that I need to find.
351.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: Give me some time. If I can figure out whatever it is that I need to do, well... then there should be more time for us.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Do you think perhaps another Nightfall ceremony is out of the question...?

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: Perhaps another time - Lady Shar is sated for now. But your eagerness to do more wickedness is noted.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Your goddess surely can't approve of what you and I share.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: Who is to say? Perhaps she's keen to see me corrupt you.

231.speaker: Shadowheart
231.text: I can imagine she'd be delighted to turn a follower of Selûne towards the darkness.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Admit it - you've never had a relationship quite like this one, have you?

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: Even if I could remember, I'm not sure I'd tell you. I don't want your ego to get over-inflated.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I want to end things between us.

123.speaker: Shadowheart
123.text: Just like that...? I thought we had something special. Something lasting.

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Clearly I was mistaken. But at least it's a mistake I won't make twice.
149.context: NodeContext: Tone hardening after the shock of being dumped

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: More likely that it'll just put a stop to us. I wanted nothing to do with those illithid powers before - what makes you think I'd want to jump into an even deeper hole?
68.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a player who has already taken the step of becoming half-mind flayer

270.speaker: Shadowheart
270.text: Do you know what this entails? Well of course you do. But I don't want that for myself.
270.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a player who has already taken the step of becoming half-mind flayer

190.speaker: Shadowheart
190.text: You know what that offer truly entails, don't you? Become half a mind flayer. Lose half of yourself. I don't want that.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Trust me. We need these powers... and you're going to love what you can do with them.

263.speaker: Shadowheart
263.text: ... fine. I truly hope you're right about this.

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: ... fine. I truly hope you're right about this.

109.text: I gave you my answer. Now drop it.

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.text: I gave you my answer. Now drop it.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Trust me. We need these powers... and you're going to love what you can do with them.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Trust me. We need these powers... and you're going to love what you can do with them.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Very well. If your mind is set, I won't try to change it.

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: They're ravenous predators with fangs like daggers - it's hardly an irrational fear to harbour.
70.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

232.speaker: Shadowheart
232.text: You've been decent to me, so far. Maybe if you can... don't make me face any more of them. At least not alone.
232.context: NodeContext: Sincere/on good terms with the player. Referring to her fear of wolves.

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: Don't be surprised if I'm reluctant to face any more.
122.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: You already know my biggest secrets. What more can you ask?
76.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: What drew you to Shar worship?
116.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

297.speaker: Shadowheart
297.text: She took me in when no one else would. Without her, I wouldn't be alive.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: She is my Mother. She nurtures me, cares for me, loves me.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: Don't believe the lies the Selûnites tell.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Tell me something about yourself besides Shar, besides tadpoles.
103.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: What, besides my life's calling and the greatest problem I've ever faced...?
13.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

193.speaker: Shadowheart
193.text: Well... I like night orchids and can't swim. Is that the sort of thing you meant?
193.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You'll have to point out night orchids to me if we ever pass some.
46.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Anything else you'd care to share?

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Really? You've flown between the planes of existence, but you've never been swimming?
173.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: It's nothing to laugh at. Save your questions if that's how you're going to react.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: That's exactly it. Anything else you'd care to share?
63.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

325.speaker: Shadowheart
325.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: Quite literally, I mean. With my memories suppressed, I can't betray Shar's secrets... but I can't remember much of myself either.
162.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH already mentioned her memory loss elsewhere.

342.speaker: Shadowheart
342.text: I mean... I literally can't. There's certain things I can't remember right now.

237.speaker: Shadowheart
237.text: Shar's secrets must be preserved above all else. All who worship her know this.

212.speaker: Shadowheart
212.text: I have had certain memories suppressed - voluntarily - so that I can serve Shar without compromising her.

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: If I manage to return to Baldur's Gate and fulfil Shar's mission... then my memories will be restored.

265.speaker: Player
265.text: What's this mission you speak of?

269.speaker: Shadowheart
269.text: That is not for you to know. Leave it at that.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: You've had your memories suppressed? That seems... extreme.

130.speaker: Shadowheart
130.text: Of course. It is an act of faith - not to be undertaken lightly. Shar will reward me, when I succeed.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: There has to be more to share. It's all right; you can tell me.

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: You're talking about Halsin, aren't you? I don't blame you. It'd take a cold heart and cobwebbed loins to ignore him. But what exactly did you have in mind?
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: raised eyebrowNodeContext: Teasing, probing

293.speaker: Player
293.text: He's open-minded, and willing to share... as long as you are.
293.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: Bold of you to ask. Some might take the suggestion very badly...
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: ... luckily for you, I don't count among their number. If you have a chance to climb Mount Halsin, well I'd be cruel to deny you. I'll be waiting to hear the details afterwards.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

127.speaker: Player
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

166.speaker: Shadowheart
166.text: I'm sure. Have your fun. Perhaps I'll have mine.

214.speaker: Player
214.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: Of course. In the spirit of open-mindedness. I want to hear it all.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I don't want to end things with you, just so we're clear.
261.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

354.speaker: Shadowheart
354.text: I understand. Feel free to have your fun. Perhaps I'll have mine.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: I'm glad you were so understanding.
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

199.speaker: Shadowheart
199.text: I'm glad that understanding's been noticed. Hasn't always been the case with others, trust me.

271.speaker: Player
271.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: Deny yourself then. Just remember that I'm not the obstacle.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken with a nonchalant shrug.NodeContext: Spoken with a shrug. 'You do you'.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: Was there anything else, besides your increasingly complex love life?

157.speaker: Player
157.text: He wants me. And I want him. I'm not sure if there's space for you and I.

337.speaker: Shadowheart
337.text: Are you sure? He's large, granted. But I can squeeze in any number of places.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Forget it. Just my wandering eye. I'll tell him I'm not interested.

241.speaker: Shadowheart
241.text: But that's not quite true, is it? You are interested.

294.speaker: Shadowheart
294.text: If you have a chance to climb Mount Halsin, well I'd be cruel to deny you. I'll be waiting to hear the details afterwards.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: Must we? No harm in a little mystery, don't you think?
96.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approves of Player for 10 or moreNodeContext: Casual, but with a guardedness under the surface.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You don't want to talk about yourself?
97.context: NodeContext: Casually deflecting from the question

319.speaker: Shadowheart
319.text: I should hope not. Have you ever heard the people who want to talk about themselves? I'm doing you a favour.
319.context: NodeContext: Casually deflecting from the question

289.speaker: Player
289.text: Maybe I'd like to get to know you better.
289.context: NodeContext: Genuine, but her guard's still up a little

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Sweet of you... but don't worry - I'm sure you'll get to know me just fine by travelling together. No need for interrogations just yet.
105.context: NodeContext: Genuine, but her guard's still up a little

217.speaker: Player
217.text: If that's what you prefer, I can respect that.

252.speaker: Player
252.text: Not good enough - are you hiding something from me?

205.speaker: Player
205.text: You're deflecting - are you hiding something from me?

151.speaker: Shadowheart
151.text: Say for a moment that I was. Do you think your blunt approach would get me to confess?

301.speaker: Player
301.text: I suppose not. We can let the matter rest for now, if you'd rather.
301.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player increases by 1NodeContext: Appreciative, but with an implicit warning to not pry into her business

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: Good. I like you - and you did save my life. I wouldn't want to sour things between us - not while we need each other.
106.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player increases by 1NodeContext: Appreciative, but with an implicit warning to not pry into her business

313.speaker: Shadowheart
313.text: Good. I like you - I wouldn't want to sour things between us. Not while we need each other.
313.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player increases by 1NodeContext: Appreciative, but with an implicit warning to not pry into her business

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Blunt's all I have left if you keep being so evasive.
183.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player decreases by 1NodeContext: Flinty and disappointed.

304.speaker: Shadowheart
304.text: A shame you feel that way. Just don't expect me to entertain your questions if you won't respect my privacy
304.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player decreases by 1NodeContext: Flinty and disappointed.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: If you're not comfortable, I won't press you.
332.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player increases by 1NodeContext: Quietly relieved the player's dropping the subject

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: Thank you. I'm sure we'll get along perfectly well.
142.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval of player increases by 1NodeContext: Quietly relieved the player's dropping the subject

49.speaker: Player
49.text: We have to rely on each other. Easier if we knew each other as well.
49.context: NodeContext: Casually deflecting from the question

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.text: Easier's often less interesting. Besides, we've plenty of reason to rely on each other already - you can't confide in just anyone about a monster in your head.
181.context: NodeContext: Casually deflecting from the question

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: Conversation shouldn't be made - it should be grown. Let the seeds sprout in their own time.

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: I suppose you've noticed I'm not terribly fond of wolves...
121.context: NodeContext: A little sheepish (she will have had a fearful reaction to a wolf in gameplay). Can be applied to any SH arc

167.speaker: Shadowheart
167.text: Of course - but remember. Lady Shar comes first.
167.context: NodeContext: 'Is now really the best time?' Spoken during the climactic sequence of Act 3

207.speaker: Shadowheart
207.text: You could fill several volumes with all that's happened to us. Perhaps the reminiscing should wait until the day is won... or not.
207.context: NodeContext: 'Is now really the best time?' Spoken during the climactic sequence of Act 3

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.text: You could fill several volumes with all that's happened to us. Perhaps the reminiscing should wait until the day is won... or not.
224.context: NodeContext: 'Is now really the best time?' Spoken during the climactic sequence of Act 3

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: Hard to fathom really... all the way from that pod, through the wilds, and finally back to where it started for me.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: It'll make for quite a bedtime tale for the children, if you ever get me in a family way.
143.context: NodeContext: Cheeky. Addressed to love interest.

346.speaker: Shadowheart
346.text: It'll make quite a bedtime tale for the children - if I survive to have any, that is.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: Honestly, I'm still surprised that we actually managed to defeat Ketheric Thorm. Perhaps a final victory isn't such a wild dream after all...
152.context: NodeContext: Processing a huge change in her life. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: I'm not sure I can even think about that right now... I'm still wrapping my mind around what happened in the Shadowfell...
126.context: NodeContext: Processing a huge change in her life. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: Lady Shar has chosen me. Words can't convey how I feel. All I know is that I must prove her faith in me to be well-placed...
340.context: NodeContext: Still processing her new status as Shar's chosen. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar

338.speaker: Shadowheart
338.text: It's a lot to process - nautiloids, tadpoles, the escape, the wilderness... and now I've seen an entire land under the sway of Lady Shar's power.
338.context: NodeContext: Dry response to a overly-broad question.

321.speaker: Shadowheart
321.text: Honestly, I think I'm caught for words.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: 'All that's happened.' You have a talent for understatement, you know that? Specifics, please.
7.context: NodeContext: Dry response to a overly-broad question.

230.speaker: Shadowheart
230.text: We've been through quite a lot, with likely more to come. Care to narrow it down a little?
230.context: NodeContext: Dry response to a overly-broad question.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You must have thoughts about our little stowaways.
32.context: NodeContext: She'd rather not dwell on the sword of Damocles more than necessary.

314.speaker: Shadowheart
314.text: Must I? Thinking about it won't help. We know what to do, so let's do it.
314.context: NodeContext: She'd rather not dwell on the sword of Damocles more than necessary.

309.speaker: Shadowheart
309.text: Find a way to rid ourselves of these things. I don't think I need to repeat where we stand on that front.
309.context: NodeContext: Restating her (and our) first priority.

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: Find a way to rid ourselves of these things.
268.context: NodeContext: Restating her (and our) first priority.

307.speaker: Shadowheart
307.text: Personally, I think we should go to Moonrise Towers. From what Minthara said, that sounds like where we'll find answers.

341.speaker: Shadowheart
341.text: Personally, I think Halsin's advice about getting to Moonrise sounds like the most promising option.

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.text: As for what he said about a Dark Justiciar stronghold in the Underdark... I'll need to see that for myself. If true - and Shar willing, it is - it could be invaluable to us.

243.speaker: Shadowheart
243.text: As for what he said about a Dark Justiciar stronghold in the Underdark... we should keep watch for it. Something tells me such a place could be of use to us.

210.speaker: Shadowheart
210.text: Personally, I think finding this 'Halsin' is our best bet.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: There's also Volo. If he's as knowledgeable as he boasts to be, perhaps he can help.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: Or there's Ethel. Not that I'm keen to trust her.

247.speaker: Shadowheart
247.text: If we're truly desperate, we can try to convince that goblin, Gut, in assisting us.

348.speaker: Shadowheart
348.text: I'm not too hopeful that a gith crèche will actually prove our salvation, but worth keeping in mind.

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: There's Volo. If he's as knowledgeable as he boasts to be, perhaps he can help.

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: We could speak to Ethel. Though I'm not keen to trust her.

144.speaker: Shadowheart
144.text: I'm not too hopeful that a gith crèche will actually prove our salvation, but worth keeping in mind.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: We've no solid leads right now though - we'd best get hunting.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: If you discover anything that might help us, I'm all ears.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: What will you do, if we actually manage to remove the tadpoles?
112.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: I will continue to serve Shar, of course. My path brings me to Baldur's Gate. Perhaps our paths will continue to intertwine, if the Dark Lady wills it.
58.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: I suppose we'd go our separate ways - not a slight on your company, of course.
75.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

141.speaker: Player
141.text: No reason for us to not stay together if we get on well.
141.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Perhaps, perhaps not. If we do survive, we'll have separate lives to return to. I need to get to Baldur's Gate.
189.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

267.speaker: Shadowheart
267.text: There's someone waiting for me there. Someone I have to reach, as soon as possible.
267.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

326.speaker: Player
326.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

343.speaker: Shadowheart
343.text: Let's just say it's a very personal, very private acquaintance.
343.context: NodeContext: Politely shutting down the topic

286.speaker: Player
286.text: Seems personal. I won't pry, if it's not something you want to talk about.
286.context: NodeContext: Grateful and a little relieved

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Thank you. And you're right, it's... a delicate matter. Not something for light conversation.
36.context: NodeContext: Grateful and a little relieved

344.speaker: Shadowheart
344.text: If you must know, Baldur's Gate.
344.context: NodeContext: Cagey. Not enjoying the personal questions.

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: We go our separate ways, of course - what else? The ties that bind would be well and truly severed.
81.context: NodeContext: Airily dismissing any rapport that's developed. Keeping things at a distance.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: You seem eager to be rid of me.
150.context: NodeContext: Cagey. Not enjoying the personal questions.

253.speaker: Shadowheart
253.text: We were brought together by circumstance. Besides, I have my own people in Baldur's Gate.
253.context: NodeContext: Cagey. Not enjoying the personal questions.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: And before you ask, no. I'm not telling you what I'm doing there, or who I'm meeting, or anything else.
147.context: NodeContext:  Increasingly terse. Pre-emptive shut down of any more questions.

55.speaker: Player
55.context: NodeContext: Spoken with quiet conviction. This is not an idle threat.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: You pry too much. Any further, and you'll regret it, understand?
71.context: NodeContext: Spoken with quiet conviction. This is not an idle threat.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: How am I holding up in your estimations?
45.context: NodeContext: Cheeky/romantic. Address to love interest asking how their standing with her is,

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: No notes. You've exceeded my every expectation.
111.context: NodeContext: Cheeky/romantic. Address to love interest asking how their standing with her is,

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: Even if I could have made it this far without you, I don't think I'd have wanted to.
74.context: NodeContext: Appreciative/romantic. Addressed to player she's in a relationship with.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: Considering all we've been through, I think I was very lucky to find such favourable company. And attractive company too, no less.
24.context: NodeContext: Appreciative/flirty. Addressed to player she's 'dating'.

259.speaker: Shadowheart
259.text: Quite splendidly to give credit where it's due. You and I have shared some good times together, and it seems we have plenty in common...
259.context: NodeContext: Appreciative (and a little disbelieving/teasing of the player's phrasing). High level of respect for player

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: You're a better catch than I'd expected to find while fighting for survival in the wilderness.
98.context: NodeContext: Appreciative (and a little disbelieving/teasing of the player's phrasing). High level of respect for player

220.speaker: Shadowheart
220.text: And think of how far we've come together - all the ways from the Hells, back to civilisation.

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: We've already made great strides - both in distance travelled, and in more personal matters...

298.speaker: Shadowheart
298.text: You're doing just fine. After all, I'd scarcely anticipated being courted while fighting for survival in the wilderness.
298.context: NodeContext: Appreciative (and a little disbelieving/teasing of the player's phrasing). High level of respect for player

281.speaker: Shadowheart
281.text: How are you holding up? Don't be so modest - I can't remember the last time I met someone like you. Perhaps I never did, and never will again.
281.context: NodeContext: Appreciative (and a little disbelieving/teasing of the player's phrasing). High level of respect for player

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: You're someone I can actually turn to, when I don't know what to do.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: Does it even need to be asked? We're beyond me merely liking you - I think I'm a different person, owing to you.
334.context: NodeContext: Appreciative (and a little disbelieving/teasing of the player's phrasing). High level of respect for player

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: Trust isn't something that comes easily to me. But with you... I think I can make an exception.

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: I don't think I've ever had a confidante quite like you - and if I have, I can't remember them.
223.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

345.speaker: Shadowheart
345.text: After all, what I shared with you about my past, about being saved from the wolf... that is not something I would normally even dream of sharing.

318.speaker: Shadowheart
318.text: I opened up to you like I have with no one before. We bonded... but it's been downhill from there. Perhaps we can rekindle things, or perhaps not...
318.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: I don't know what to say. You and I shared good times together... but it's been downhill from there. Perhaps we can rekindle things, or perhaps not...
88.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: Besides, we've come so far now - the end isn't so distant. I may need to concentrate on what's truly important to me.

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: Maybe you and I are not meant to be, I don't know. I sense I'll have little time for distractions, moving forward. Especially ones that don't bear fruit.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: I must admit, you've been a surprise, and not an unpleasant one. Kindred spirits are few and far between for me.
187.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

226.speaker: Shadowheart
226.text: Besides, you saved my life aboard the nautiloid. How can I do anything but sing your praises?
226.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

352.speaker: Shadowheart
352.text: You're not the kind of company I'd keep willingly, but all things considered... you'll do.
352.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: And I haven't forgotten that you saved my life aboard the nautiloid. Perhaps I'll be able to return the favour at some point.
62.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Appreciative

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: If nothing else, you can at least soak up any arrows that are loosed at us.
82.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Disappointed, critical. The player isn't proving to be good company in her eyes.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Pity. You'd started off so well, saving my life aboard the nautiloid. I suppose now I'm seeing the real you.
84.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was freed during the tutorialNodeContext: Disappointed, critical. The player isn't proving to be good company in her eyes.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: You saved my life aboard the nautiloid. I'd never have expected that from a gith.
23.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for gith players/ SH saved during tutorialNodeContext: Reflective.

317.speaker: Shadowheart
317.text: And since then, you've seemed reliable. Maybe I'll have to reevaluate what I think I know about your kind.

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: But since then, well... let's just say some of my suspicions have been confirmed.

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: My estimations started at a low point as far as you're concerned, gith.
198.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for gith players/ SH NOT saved during tutorial

211.speaker: Shadowheart
211.text: But I'm not afraid to admit when I'm wrong... you seem good company so far.

353.speaker: Shadowheart
353.text: Though I suppose the only way is up from there. You'll do for now.

236.speaker: Shadowheart
236.text: Seems like even those were too high.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: What do you think about what happened to the druid grove?

328.speaker: Shadowheart
328.text: I suppose some would commend our actions - goblins would've razed that whole place to nothing if it weren't for us.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: What do you think about what happened to the druid grove?

110.speaker: Player
110.text: What do you think about what happened to the druid grove?

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: If we hadn't killed the goblins' leaders, they'd have turned that grove to ashes. We're owed quite a debt, I believe.

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: No excuse to rest on our laurels though - we've still got our own problems to contend with.

336.speaker: Player
336.text: What do you think about what happened to the druid grove?

256.speaker: Shadowheart
256.text: What's there to think about? Goblins spilled blood, but we survived. That's all that matters.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: What do you think about what happened to the druid grove?

185.speaker: Shadowheart
185.text: That place is sealed off to the world now - I don't see the point in dwelling on it any more. Not while we've our own problems to see to.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: We haven't gone all that far yet - what are you referring to exactly...?

242.speaker: Shadowheart
242.text: The powers we already received have proved useful, true. But this is something different entirely...

273.speaker: Shadowheart
273.text: On one hand, they seem useful. But on the other hand - or perhaps tentacle, before long - we know where they're coming from, and what lies at the end of that path...

227.speaker: Shadowheart
227.text: I never expected ceremorphosis to be tempting. I think we should resist these powers. There's simply too many unknowns for us to risk it.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: The odds are stacked against us - can we truly afford to ignore a potential advantage?

178.speaker: Player
178.text: The odds are stacked against us - can we truly afford to ignore a potential advantage?

174.speaker: Player
174.text: The odds are stacked against us - can we truly afford to ignore a potential advantage?

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: Well... perhaps you have a point. Fine, let's explore these powers then. I just hope we don't come to regret it.

203.speaker: Shadowheart
203.text: Well... perhaps you have a point. Fine, let's explore these powers then. I just hope we don't come to regret it.

209.text: I see it as more a case of wisely avoiding a potential threat. My mind is set.

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: I see it as more a case of wisely avoiding a potential threat. My mind is set.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Some might say excessive caution is a risk in and of itself...

240.speaker: Shadowheart
240.text: And some might say eels and turnips boiled in milk is a delicacy, but some are fools. I'll make my own mind up.

279.speaker: Shadowheart
279.text: It all stems from that childhood memory I suppose... it's strange. I know now that it was my father I saw, yet still, I can't suppress the fear.
279.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

355.speaker: Shadowheart
355.text: I suppose fear doesn't have to be rational. But maybe, given time, I can put it behind me.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I'll try to avoid wolves in future, where possible.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: I suppose a friend of nature such as yourself will know how to avoid them - provided you don't turn into one, of course.

266.speaker: Shadowheart
266.text: Thank you. I had a feeling you'd be understanding.

275.speaker: Shadowheart
275.text: You will? Well... thank you. I appreciate it.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Everyone's got their own fears. I won't judge yours.
308.context: NodeContext: Slightly surprised. Referring to her fear of wolves/the player's lack of judgement

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: You're unlike the Mother Superior, then.
48.context: NodeContext: Slightly surprised. Referring to her fear of wolves/the player's lack of judgement

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: Maybe that's what I like about you. You're different.
182.context: NodeContext: Warm/on good terms with the player

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: In either case, it's not something I want to dwell on, just now.

335.speaker: Shadowheart
335.text: Really? Some might think it makes me a liability.
335.context: NodeContext: Slightly surprised. Referring to her fear of wolves/the player's lack of judgement

169.speaker: Player
169.text: We can scarcely afford to show weakness right now. I hope this won't be a problem.
169.context: NodeContext: Sincere/on good terms with the player. Referring to her fear of wolves

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: I hope so too. I'll try my best to keep it under control.
119.context: NodeContext: Sincere/on good terms with the player. Referring to her fear of wolves

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: That's out of my hands. I think I've said all I want to on the subject.
5.context: NodeContext: A little terse. Referring to her fear of wolves

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Wolves though, really? They're just dogs with no table manners.
215.context: NodeContext: A little terse. Player mocked her fear of wolves

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: You can tell that to the next one we cross paths with then. Provided it doesn't tear your throat out first.
10.context: NodeContext: A little terse. Player mocked her fear of wolves

284.speaker: Shadowheart
284.text: I've always been terrified of them, ever since I was a child. I showed you my memory of when I was lost in the woods. It can hardly come as a surprise.
284.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: The Mother Superior wasn't above using it against me. If I disobeyed, sometimes instead of a whipping, she'd threaten to drag me to a wolf den. Never failed to bring me back in line.
30.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: Why is it always the bad memories I can still recall...? In any case, I'll be keen to avoid them.
202.context: NodeContext: Referring to her fear of wolves.

299.speaker: Shadowheart
299.context: NodeContext: Slightly playful (in response to player she's 'dating')

310.speaker: Shadowheart
310.text: Very serious of you. But go ahead.
310.context: NodeContext: Slightly playful (in response to player she's 'dating')
